messages.content: What is the purpose of the Demofusion Custom Node in ComfyUI?

The Demofusion Custom Node in ComfyUI is a wrapper that adapts the Demofusion technique created by Ruoyi Du to the ComfyUI environment, allowing users to experiment with this technique within ComfyUI.
Where can the original paper and official implementations of Demofusion by Ruoyi Du be found?
The original paper and official implementations of Demofusion by Ruoyi Du can be found at https://ruoyidu.github.io/demofusion/demofusion.html and https://github.com/PRIS-CV/DemoFusion.
How can the Demofusion Custom Node be installed in ComfyUI?
To install the Demofusion Custom Node in ComfyUI, git clone the repository in the ComfyUI/custom_nodes folder and restart ComfyUI. No special procedures are needed.
What are the VRAM requirements for using the Demofusion technique?
The Demofusion technique requires a lot of VRAM, plus 18G.
What image sizes have been tested with the Demofusion Custom Node in ComfyUI?
So far, only square images with sizes 2048x2048 and 3072x3072 have been tested with the Demofusion Custom Node in ComfyUI.
Which Huggingface models have been tested with the Demofusion Custom Node in ComfyUI?
The Huggingface models stabilityai/stable-diffusion-xl-base-1.0 and stablediffusionapi/sdxl-unstable-diffusers-y have been tested with the Demofusion Custom Node in ComfyUI.
Is the Demofusion Custom Node in ComfyUI still under development?
Yes, the Demofusion Custom Node in ComfyUI is under development, and the interface may change, impacting generated workflows in future versions.
